name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Yorkville Library
description:
The Yorkville Library and its neighbourhood is home to a variety of trees. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to explore the natural world on a local neighbourhood walk. Learn how to recognize different species and fun facts about their cultural and ecological importance.

Children under 12 must be accompanied by a parent/caregiver.

Please note, the tour will start and end at the Yorkville library branch. The City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff will guide attendees outside and around the neighbourhood where there may be uneven, unpaved surfaces. Please dress and prepare accordingly for this outdoor program (e.g. hats, sunscreen, water, comfortable shoes).

organizer.name: Urban Forestry, Natural Environment and Community Programs

name: VRTO Spatial Media World Conference & Expo
description:
Bringing together global experts in VR, AR, spatial computing, and AI. 

Experience: 
- Hands-on VR/AR activations 
- Student XR project showcases
- Talks on immersive design, virtual production, generative AI, digital humans, haptics, and more
- Networking with industry leading developers, creators, technologists, educators, producers, and business professionals

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto's local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It's a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto's thriving gaming community!

name: Shab-e She'r Poetry Night CXII
description:
Canada's most diverse and brave poetry reading open microphone series. 

Featuring readings by poets Sonja Greckol and Chet Singh and hosted by Bänoo Zan with an open microphone opportunity for poetry in any language.

name: FIVARS Festival of International Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories
description:
Now in its 11th year, is a Toronto-grown internationally renown festival.

The Runnymede Branch and its neighbourhood is home to a variety of trees. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to explore the natural world on a local neighbourhood walk. Learn how to recognize different species and fun facts about their cultural and ecological importance.

organizer.name: Urban Forestry, Natural Environment and Community Programs

name: World Vitiligo Day Innovation Summit 2025

location.name: Lake Lounge at the MaRS Waterfront

description:
Coming to Canada for the first time ever! Join us in Toronto for a global moment of unity, innovation, and visibility for the vitiligo community. This year's summit is themed "Innovation for Every Skin", spotlighting the powerful intersection of AI, medtech, and patient advocacy.

Whether you're living with vitiligo, working in dermatology, developing medical technology, or passionate about inclusive healthcare, this is your moment to connect and make an impact!

name: Flemingdon Park Streets Plan Interactive Map and Survey
description: The City is developing a Neighbourhood Streets Plan (NSP) for Flemingdon Park. The Streets Plan will investigate road safety for vulnerable road users, excessive speeding​, excessive motor vehicle traffic on neighbourhood streets​, opportunities for active transportation (walking and cycling) and access to transit stops and stations. The survey will allow you to provide feedback on issues and ideas for your community by completing the survey using an interactive map.
